snippet: As the National People’s Congress continued in Beijing, thousands of residents stood guard in the streets as the front lines in the government’s war against potential unrest.
abstract: Thousands of Beijing residents, many of them retirees, have taken up assigned posts at busy intersection as front line in Chinese government's perpetual war against potential unrest as National People's Congress continues in city.

byline.original: By DAN LEVIN and SUE-LIN WONG

lead_paragraph: As the National People’s Congress continued in Beijing, thousands of residents stood guard in the streets as the front lines in the government’s war against potential unrest.

headline.seo: Neighborhood Committees Keep Watch Over Beijing During People’s Congress
headline.main: Beijing’s Retirees Keep Eye Out for Trouble During Party Congress
headline.print_headline: Beijing’s Retirees Keep Eye Out for Trouble During Party Congress
